definition: see 驚弓之鳥|惊弓之鸟[jing1 gong1 zhi1 niao3]
to injure/injury/wound
surname Gong
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
variant of 屌[diao3]/penis
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object
female chicken crows at daybreak (idiom); a woman usurps authority/women meddle in politics/The female wears the trousers.
to aim to carve a swan and get a semblance of a duck (idiom)/to fail utterly in trying to copy something/to get a reasonably good, if not perfect, result
Sima Xiangru is meticulous and Mei Gao is fast (idiom)/to each his good points
lit. the heart of a sheep in the skin of a tiger (idiom)/fig. impressive in appearance but lacking in substance/braggart
lit. almanac from years back (idiom)/obsolete practice/old-fashioned principle
person narrow-minded and shortsighted
(of literature, music) deeply moving (idiom)
to correct in the evening a fault of the morning (idiom)/to quickly amend one's ways
flowering autumn grass, fine net (idiom); fig. abundant and exacting punishments prescribed by law
lit. a caged bird in a pavilion (idiom); fig. to lose vigilance by comfortable living/unaware of the disasters ahead/a fool's paradise
to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician
ravenous wolves hold the road (idiom); wicked people in power/a vicious tyranny rules the land
Mr Zhu Yun breaks the railing (idiom); to challenge and admonish boldly
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
